IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Injectable Collagen Scaffold™ Combined With MSCs Transplantation for Brain Injury
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: The Safety and Efficacy Assessment of Injectable Collagen Scaffold™ Combined With Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation in Patients With Brain Injury

ResponsibleParty.ResponsiblePartyInvestigatorTitle: Principal Investigator of Regenerative Medicine Laboratory, Institute of Genetics and Developmental Biology, CAS

Collaborator.CollaboratorName: Affiliated Hospital of Logistics University of CAPF

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of injectable collagen scaffold combined with Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) transplantation in patients with brain injury.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupLabel: Injectable Collagen Scaffold with MSCs Transplantation

ArmGroupInterventionName: Biological: Injectable Collagen Scaffold with MSCs Transplantation

Intervention.InterventionDescription: Stereotactic intracranial hematoma and insert the drainage tube to inhale haematoma. The drainage tube stayed in the position for 1-2 days until adequate drainage of hematomas, and then the drainage tube was pulled out.

Stereotactic intracranial hematoma and insert the drainage tube to inhale haematoma. The drainage tube stayed in the position for 1-2 days until adequate drainage of hematomas,and 10 million MSCs were transplanted into the hematoma cavity before the drainage tube was pulled out.

Intervention.InterventionName: Injectable Collagen Scaffold with MSCs Transplantation
Intervention.InterventionDescription: Stereotactic intracranial hematoma and insert the drainage tube to inhale haematoma. The drainage tube stayed in the position for 1-2 days until adequate drainage of hematomas, and injectable collagen scaffold combined with 10 million MSCs were transplanted into the hematoma cavity before the drainage tube was pulled out.

InterventionArmGroupLabel: Injectable Collagen Scaffold with MSCs Transplantation

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: Number of adverse events and participants with those adverse events
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Proportion of patients with postoperative infections and serious adverse events (SAEs) will be assessed by long term follow-up.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change in functional outcomes as measured by National Institutes of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, day 1-7, and 1, 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 month after surgery

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change in motor recovery evaluated by Brunnstrom stage
Change in self-care ability as measured by Barthel Index (BI)
Change in pain intensity as measured by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
Change in electrical brain activity as measured by Electroencephalography (EEG)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, day 1, 4, 7, and 1, 3, 6, 12, 18, 24 month after surgery

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Changes in brain electrophysiology as measured by Somatosensory evoked potential (SSEP)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, day 1,4,7, and 1, 3, 6, 12, 18, 24 month after surgery

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Change in brain pathology diagnosed by Head CT scan
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, day 1,4,7, and 1, 3, 6, 12, 18, 24 month after surgery

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Male or female，35-75 years old.
The surgery time should be > 6 hours after symptom onset.
Glasgow coma score (GCS) was 9-15.
CT diagnosis of intracerebral hemorrhage (25-40 ml), except for patients with signs of craniotomy to remove the hematoma.
Signed informed consent obtained from the patient or patient's legally authorized representative.

Exclusion Criteria:

Glasgow coma scale of <8.
Patients suffering severe heart failure, severe lung disease, uremia, cirrhosis, end-stage cancer, coagulation disorders, stroke sequela.
Asphyxia, cardiac arrest or successful cardiopulmonary resuscitation before hospitalization.
Lactating or pregnant woman.
Refuse to sign informed content.

Location.LocationFacility: Affiliated Hospital of Logistics Universtiy of CAPF
